newsitem.title: USA: CBOT soy products close lower as soybeans falter.
newsitem.headline: CBOT soy products close lower as soybeans falter.

text.p: CBOT soy product futures closed lower on a drop in soybeans, traders said.

Follow-through technical selling after Tuesday's late break in prices, bearish input from a Farmers Commodities Corp estimate for U.S. crop production and overall good crop weather in the U.S. Midwest combined to hit the market, they said.
Soyoil futures volume was estimated at 20,000 contracts, down from 23,983 Tuesday, the CBOT said. Soyoil options volume was estimated at 500 contracts, up from 428 Tuesday.
Soymeal futures volume was estimated at 24,000 contracts, up from 23,656 Tuesday. Soymeal options volume was estimated at 2,000 contracts, up from 1,589 Tuesday.
Soyoil futures closed 0.33 to 0.41 cent per lb lower with September down 0.33 at 25.05 cents. Soymeal closed $1.50 to $5.20 per ton lower, with September down $4.80 at $262.60 a ton.
